doc:
Pedro Regas https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pedro_Regas 0 [[File:Tiger Fangs (1943) film still 04.jpg|thumb|right|Dan Seymour (left) and Pedro Regas in the Frank Buck film Tiger Fangs (1943)], born Panagiotis Thomas Regaskos, veteran stage actor, Regas was spotted on the Broadway stage by Mary Pickford who persuaded him to go to Hollywood and be in pictures, which he did in 1920 and continued to play in films for 50 years. ĄĄ Regas died on August 10, 1974 in Hollywood, California of a heart attack and was interred in the Hollywood Forever Cemetery. [_[_File : Tiger_Fangs ( 1943 ) film still 04 . jpg | thumb | right | Dan_Seymour (_left ) and Pedro_Regas in the_Frank_Buck_film_Tiger_Fangs_(_1943_)_] , born Panagiotis_Thomas_Regaskos , veteran_stage_actor , Regas was_spotted on the_Broadway_stage by Mary_Pickford who persuaded him to_go to Hollywood and be in pictures , which he did in 1920 and continued_to_play in films for 50_years . ĄĄ_Regas died on August_10_,_1974 in Hollywood , California of a_heart_attack and was_interred in the_Hollywood_Forever_Cemetery .
